for_sales.sales_text: Very pretty gaff sloop dayboat. Designed by Murray Peterson, Boston, USA, 1934 Built of yellow Alaskan cedar and mahogany by Marcus Lewis, Fowey, 2006. 18ft LOA on deck. 3ft fixed bowsprit Long straight keel. Draft 2ft 6ins. Reliable 13.5 hp Beta inboard engine. 2-bladed fixed prop. Mainsail and jib in good repair. Wykham Martin jib furling. Ground tackle, legs, autohelm 100, fenders, cushions, mooring ropes and winter covers. Easily sailed single-handed. (2.8m inflatable dinghy with O/B available as extras if required) Lying afloat at Weymouth Sailing Club. Owner swallowing anchor because of age.

boat.name: BlueBelle
boat.short_description: A one-off long-keel auxiliary gaff sloop designed in 1934 but only built in 2006.
